intro: Dortmanna mexicana, commonly known as Mexican Dortmanna, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and linear, and it produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the spring. Dortmanna mexicana is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and along streambanks.
